properties.title: Toronto Java User Group - Agentic RAG with Evaluations and MCP - Dan Dobrin
properties.description:
The Toronto Java User Group (TJUG) is a community-driven meetup for Java developers in the Toronto area. We host monthly events featuring expert talks, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities covering topics like modern Java frameworks, performance optimization, and best practices. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer, TJUG provides a space to learn, share knowledge, and connect with fellow Java practitioners. Join the group to stay up to date with the latest in Java development and grow your skills in a collaborative environment.

Talk Details
Build more capable and reliable AI systems by combining context-aware retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) with agentic decision-making in an enterprise AI platform, all in Java! This session covers everything from architecture, context construction, and model routing to action planning, dynamic retrieval, and recursive reasoning, as well as the implementation of essential guardrails and monitoring systems for safe deployments. Learn about best practices, trade-offs, performance, and advanced techniques like evaluations and model context protocol.

About the venue
Free Times Cafe has bistro-style seating and a full food and drink menu. Please consider helping to support the venue by planning to have supper during the talk.

Presenter Info
Dan Dobrin is an App Architect in Google Cloud, helping customer teams adopt modern cloud-native patterns, practices and technologies. His focus is on GenAI, Vertex, Gemini, CodeAssist, Cloud Run, K8s, Native Java Images, Spring, Event-driven Architectures, Production-readiness and Performance Optimization.

Prior to joining Google Cloud, he has built highly scalable, low-latency, frameworks for technology, security and financial services organizations.

Recent conference talks: Google Cloud Next24, Spring I/O 2024 and Devoxx Belgium 2024

properties.title: 2025 World Vitiligo Day Innovation Summit
properties.description:
Vitiligo affects nearly 100 million people worldwide – not just physically, but emotionally and socially too. Today, the conversation is louder and more powerful than ever – and this year, Canada proudly joins the global movement.

World Vitiligo Day is one of the largest health awareness movements in the world, in 2025 its Canadian history. For the very first time, the World Vitiligo Day comes to Toronto, shining a powerful spotlight on vitiligo and the incredible global community behind it.

Hosted by Skinopathy in partnership with the Vitiligo Research Foundation and in collaboration with Vitiligo Voices Canada, this year’s theme, “Innovation for Every Skin” explores how artificial intelligence, medtech, and research are revolutionizing care, access, and equity for people with vitiligo.

Join us learn how you can help those with vitiligo!

properties.title: Being Online workshop
properties.description:
​Many people are turned off by the prospect of using social media to achieve personal or professional goals. Whether it's the tone of the online arena or the act of reducing oneself to an abstracted profile, it can be an unpleasant and alienating space to occupy. 

​Being Online is a response to this aversion, a workshop on translating self-reflection into an online persona that feels genuine, maintains itself, and results in real world achievements. It is not a session about maximizing impressions, gaining followers, or gaming algorithms. Instead participants will be exploring how their personal goals and strategies can translate into tactics that feel natural and resonate with people on a genuine level. Among the topics we'll cover are: the concept of self as explored by philosophers and graphic novelists, the use of classical rhetorical strategies in 280 characters or less, and case studies on successful real world applications. 

​About the speaker
Dan Seljak is a marketing professional who has been working in the "built environment" for the past decade. Between helping architects, landscape designers and planners win work, his multi-media project Another Glass Box serves as an outlet for his more civic-oriented projects. His focus is on getting people excited about participating in civic life and restoring agency to citizen actors by delivering clear, informative, and (hopefully) fun messaging about how to engage communities and municipalities.

properties.title: Business Intelligence in Action: Hands-on Microsoft Power BI Clinic
properties.description:
Join us for PRAKTIKAI’s first hands-on workshop with our Power BI Clinic. Open to practitioners in business intelligence of all skill levels, from beginners to seasoned users.

​In this 2-hour session, we’ll introduce the essential features of Power BI and quickly move on to the theoretical backing for good data visualization and dashboard design and then go hands-on with to build a dashboard from scratch.

​We’ll also have time allotted at the end of the workshop for Q&A and 1-1 work in the clinic portion. Come with questions or your own business intelligence questions and let us help you level up your Power BI skills.

​Agenda:
​🎬 Introduction & Overview (20 minutes): Background on Power BI, evolution of the platform, market positioning, core capabilities
​📊 Visualization Fundamentals (30 minutes): Learn about best practices for designing clear, effective, and informative visuals
​⚒️ Power BI – Hands-on (40 minutes): Step-by-step guidance on creating your own dashboard, from importing data to setting up measures and creating visualizations using an example industry dataset (30 minutes)
​🩺 Q&A & Power BI Clinic (30 minutes): Clear your doubts and discuss challenges with us and other users, live and in-person. Apply what you've learned by working on a project of your choice or building on our example dashboard.

​Who Should Attend:
- This workshop is suitable for practitioners of all skill levels, and even those completely new to Power BI wishing to learn:
- ​Beginners in data and analytics wanting to get started with Power BI
- ​Intermediate users looking to refine their skills and design best-in-class dashboards
- ​Professionals who manage or analyze data as part of their role

​About the presenters:
You can learn more about PRAKTIKAI and your presenters here: https://www.praktikai.com/company

​Technical Requirements:
To join this workshop, attendees must have Power BI installed on their device. The workshop will be conducted entirely within the Power BI platform. You can download an install the latest version of Power BI here: microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/products/power-bi/downloads

​Contact Us: For any questions prior to the event, please reach out directly via the event form or at via email at contact at PRAKTIKAI dot com.

properties.title: HOW TO BECOME A BILLION DOLLAR STARTUP - Super.com Tech Playbooks
properties.description:
Join the engineering leadership team from Super.com who will present playbooks with step-by-step guidance on how we grew from series A to C. Participants will have a chance to hear from our CTO Ryan Fox presenting a playbook for org scaling and strategic investments as you scale. With additional playbook presentations on how to measure your engineering organization, build world class infra eng. and CI/CD tuned for the developer experience. We will also present playbooks for building engineering culture, delivering self serve experimentation, and how to identify the correct technical debt and investments as your product matures. 

The format of our presentations are designed to be practical and actionable so other engineering leaders and founders can learn from what helped us become a thriving and profitable scaleup. We have topics for engineering leaders and managers at all levels, infrastructure engineers and those interested in improving DX, experimentation, and more!  

Agenda:
-4:00PM - Super.com open house (doors open)

-5:00PM - Ryan Fox, CTO - A playbook for scaling your engineering org.
Description: You’ve achieved product-market fit and you’re ready to scale. This playbook presentation will cover type and the sequencing of key strategic decisions related to org structure, technical investments, product lifecycle, and how to ensure you maintain technical excellence as you grow from 10 engineers to more than 100 that made Super.com successful.

-5:30PM - Matt Culver, Engineering Chief of Staff - How to measure an engineering org. 
Description: A data driven approach to measuring your growing tech company. A step by step playbook for picking measures that are meaningful to your org, and how to align incentives between your engineers and business by picking measures that improve developer experience.

-6:00PM - Nomaan Ahmed, Sr. Director Product Eng - Building empowered engineering culture. 
Description: Having a great company needs great culture. We will present a step by step playbook on how [Super.com](http://Super.com) built empowered engineering culture by focusing on empathy, maximizing team autonomy, and encouraging leadership from within teams by using guilds.

-6.30PM - Gage Sonntag, Sr Director Data Eng & Analytics - Self serve product experimentation and 10x the rate your teams can learn from and make product decisions.
Description: Using a robust experimentation framework at your company will improve the validity of your A/B testing outcomes and vastly increase the rate at which you can learn and optimize your product. Learn how Super.com delivers 2.5 experiments per person per quarter and does so with 90%+ developer satisfaction.

-7:00PM - Kyle Pericak, Director Infrastructure Eng - Building killer developer infrastructure, a playbook for becoming “unbound”.
Description: Super.com’s journey towards building killer Developer Infrastructure and optimizing for cycle time. Learn how we provide fast and affordable per-developer dev/test environments, built trust in our automated test systems, implemented CD with canary verification, and migrated from ChatOps to fully automated deployments. We’ll cover how we’re leveraging AI and our developer platform to manage change at scale, what tools we use, and which ones have added the most value.

-7:30PM - Kevin Godfrey, Director Product Eng -  Tackling the right tech debt at the right time. 
Description: A playbook for how to identify the *correct* engineering investments and tech debt to address as your product matures. A practical playbook on how to identify high value investment areas, scope, and deliver them, as well as practical guidance on how to connect business value to technical investment decisions.

-8:00PM - Wrap up cocktail hour and open Q&A - Opportunity to get face time with Super.com technology leadership to discuss a decision or challenge you are facing in your own org with one of the presenters.

properties.title: MaRS Mornings: Frontiers of AI in Toronto’s Discovery District
properties.description:
​Visit the epicentre of AI innovation — Toronto's Discovery District — where modern artificial intelligence was crafted by Nobel Laureate Geoffrey Hinton and continues to evolve through world-leading research and commercialization. 

​​Frontiers of AI is a day of programming on June 25 delivered in partnership with MaRS, the University of Toronto (UofT) and Vector Institute, featuring a hands-on showcase of Canadian innovation that is shaping the global future of AI — take part in engaging conversations, demos, workshops and networking. Meet emerging and established leaders in AI, alongside decision-makers in business and tech.

​​​Located in the heart of Toronto's innovation corridor, this event brings together three powerhouse institutions that have helped establish Toronto as a world-leading AI hub: MaRS, the world's largest urban innovation hubs; the University of Toronto, home to pioneering AI breakthroughs that sparked the global AI revolution and The Vector Institute, renowned for bridging cutting-edge AI research with real-world applications across 32 enterprise partners and 200+ startups.

​MaRS Mornings will take place from 10:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. at the MaRS Centre. Join us for:

​Panel discussions on current developments and the long-term impacts of AI
​Special focus on breakthrough applications in health, climate and emerging technologies

​​This event is open to:

​​Founders and entrepreneurs in AI and deep tech
​​Corporate innovation leaders and investors
​​AI researchers and practitioners
​​Students and professionals interested in AI careers
​​Industry partners seeking AI collaboration opportunities

​​Why Toronto's Discovery District: Home to Nobel Prize-winning AI research, U of T and Vector Institute's globally renowned AI expertise, the MaRS Centre and a concentration of research hospitals and innovation centres all within a 5-block radius, the Discovery District represents the intersection of academic excellence, industry innovation, and startup dynamism that makes Toronto a unique global AI hub.

​​Event Access: Free, open to the public

Registration is required due to limited capacity

​​Join us in celebrating Toronto leading deep technology startups as well as its legacy as the birthplace of modern AI. Explore how our ecosystem continues to shape the future of technology and innovation globally.

properties.title: COMMON CODE: How do we shift from “always on” to “intentionally present”?
properties.description:
In a world designed to keep us constantly connected, what does it mean to truly be present? This conversation invites us to explore digital burnout, attention fatigue, and the possibilities of being fully here - with ourselves, each other, and our surroundings. Together, we’ll reflect on how Toronto’s tech culture might help shape new norms around presence, pace, and pause. 

__

Five days. Five public spaces. Five big questions. 

Common Code is a free pop-up conversation series hosted by Reset that invites Toronto’s tech community to gather in public spaces to explore questions at the intersection of tech, trust, and togetherness in Toronto. Each day, we bring a new question to life in a different neighbourhood that invites Town Hall-like dialogue and debate on topics related to surveillance, sovereignty, safety and more. An unplug valet will be available at each pop-up for anyone wishing to go phone free.

properties.title: Frontiers of AI: Insights from a Nobel Laureate (U of T x Desjardins Speaker Series)
properties.description:
Visit the epicentre of AI innovation — Toronto's Discovery District — where modern artificial intelligence was crafted by Nobel Laureate Geoffrey Hinton and continues to evolve through world-leading research and commercialization. 

​​Join University Professor Emeritus and Nobel Prize winner, Geoffrey Hinton, for a candid conversation with Nick Frosst, Co-Founder of Cohere, on the opportunities, challenges, and obligations when building a new venture leveraging the power of artificial intelligence.

​​Artificial intelligence adoption has quickly captured the public imagination and sparked important debates around the world. Governments, business leaders and global citizens are having critical conversations about whether and how AI should be regulated and what guardrails need to be in place to protect society. Advocates on both sides argue about both the enormous potential and risks of this disruptive technology. The rapid emergence of generative AI and large language models (LLMs) has accelerated this debate.

​​The fireside chat will cover a broad range of topics, including:

​​- Canada’s place in the AI revolution
- Do LLMs understand language in the same way as we do?
- Reasons for optimism
- ​​Risks of AI
- Is digital intelligence better than analog intelligence?

​Frontiers of AI is a day of programming on June 25 delivered in partnership with the University of Toronto (U of T), MaRS and The Vector Institute, featuring a hands-on showcase of Canadian innovation that is shaping the global future of AI — take part in engaging conversations, demos, workshops and networking. Meet emerging and established leaders in AI, alongside decision-makers in business and tech.

​​Located in the heart of Toronto's innovation corridor, this event brings together three powerhouse institutions that have helped establish Toronto as a world-leading AI hub: MaRS, the world's largest urban innovation hubs; the University of Toronto, home to pioneering AI breakthroughs that sparked the global AI revolution and The Vector Institute, renowned for bridging cutting-edge AI research with real-world applications across 32 enterprise partners and 200+ startups.

​This event is open to:

​​- Founders and entrepreneurs in AI and deep tech
- Corporate innovation leaders and investors
- AI researchers and practitioners
- Students and professionals interested in AI careers
- Industry partners seeking AI collaboration opportunities

​Registration is required due to limited capacity.

properties.title: Buy in, Stand out: Your climate action starts with carbon removal
properties.description: Lately, tech companies like Microsoft, Meta, and Google have made headlines for major purchases of carbon removal credits — where they pay companies up front for taking carbon dioxide out of the atmosphere. The carbon removal companies themselves utilize incredible tech so economic and environmental benefits of these purchases are particularly synergistic. properties.title: Women in STEM – Unleash Your Unique Leadership Voice with Confidence (Toronto Tech Week Event)
properties.description:
You got the IT expertise✅. You got the years of project management experience ✅. Yet there is a voice in your head that says, “You are not a leader.” 
Do you have doubts on your confidence to communicate as a leader, able to close the deal, connect with clients, vendors, colleagues, investors? Effective communications and self-confidence are key to your success. 

Not sure what it takes? We can help.

Join Amy Au (Innovate You) and Hilda Gan (People Bright Consulting), experts in People Leadership and Confidence development, for an empowering workshop during Toronto Tech Week 2025 designed for Women in STEM—executives, senior managers, and high-growth startup leaders. This dynamic session includes intentional networking to uplift and connect, and a transformative mini workshop using the Fascinate® System to help participants discover their unique value and communication style. Through interactive exercises, attendees will build leadership confidence, learn to amplify their voices, and drive inclusive impact in their organizations. Leave inspired, equipped to lead authentically, and connected with a powerful network of trailblazing women across industries.

Amy Au, Founder & Executive Coach at Innovate You, Fascinate® Certified Advisor who radiates inspiring transformation.
With over 25 years in the technology sector, including a decade in leadership roles. Amy experienced firsthand, navigating the challenges of being a woman in a male-dominated field. She now emphasizes empowering Women leaders in STEM to amplify their voices, lead authentically with confidence, and advance to the C-Suite while being fulfilled.

Hilda Gan loves to help people build their confidence. She is the Founder of People Bright Consulting, a strategic HR consulting and leadership development firm that fosters people-centric work cultures and leaders. A serial entrepreneur with a background in nursing, IT, engineering, and HR, she and her husband created a Best Workplaces in Canada, ranking in the Top 10 twice.

On this tour, we'll explore those stories — tales of ghosts, murder, spectres and séances — and see what they can teach us about the history of the school and the city that surrounds it. The 90-minute tour will start at Massey College and end at the Royal Ontario Museum.

The event will be the perfect opportunity to connect and exchange insights on the venture and tech landscapes from Claire Fauquier, Venture Partner at Brightspark (Toronto), and Arteen Arabshahi, General Partner at Fika Ventures (Los Angeles).

​Brightspark Ventures is a top performing Canadian early-stage venture firm, actively investing in exceptional entrepreneurs since 1999. They are known to partner early with founders, and to provide capital and support for the long run. Brightspark manages over $500M across traditional VC Funds, as well as under a syndicate investment model open to individual and non-institutional investors.

​About Fika Ventures is an early-stage venture capital firm focused on B2B software startups, with an emphasis on pre-Series A companies. Our expertise spans vertical SaaS, fintech, commerce enablement, healthcare, and marketplaces, particularly those harnessing AI to drive innovation. We pride ourselves on a hands-on, collaborative approach, viewing ourselves as true partners in building your business—not the other way around.

This interactive fireside chat format encourages an open and insightful dialogue, offering attendees the opportunity to hear firsthand perspectives, ask  questions, and gain a deeper understanding of how AI is reshaping the future of fintech.

properties.title: COMMON CODE: How can we reimagine capturing content in public spaces to better enable trust, safety, and presence?
properties.description:
Photos and videos are everywhere, but our comfort with being captured isn’t always equal. This gathering opens space to rethink how we create, share, and consume content in public - especially in moments or movements where safety and trust matter most. What would it take to document with care, and create norms that protect both presence and power?

---

Five days. Five public spaces. Five big questions. 

Common Code is a free pop-up conversation series hosted by Reset that invites Toronto’s tech community to gather in public spaces to explore questions at the intersection of tech, trust, and togetherness in Toronto. Each day, we bring a new question to life in a different neighbourhood that invites Town Hall-like dialogue and debate on topics related to surveillance, sovereignty, safety and more. An unplug valet will be available at each pop-up for anyone wishing to go phone free.

properties.title: Powering the Electric Mind: Culture, Wellbeing & Mindfulness in Tech
properties.description:
Real innovation starts with people. Powering the Electric Mind is a spirited conversation about how we can reshape the future of work by putting culture, wellbeing, and mindfulness at the heart of everything we do.

​​Join our expert panelists as they share real-world insights on what it takes to build workplaces where creativity soars, people feel seen, and teams achieve lasting success. This isn’t about perks and buzz words, it’s about finding purpose, making connections, and building a culture that inspires from the inside out. 

​​Whether you're a founder, leader, HR professional, or a technologist passionate about better work environments, this event will inspire you to help lead meaningful change in your organization.

​​Some of the topics we’ll touch on:
​​*Leading with empathy, authenticity, and impact
​​*Leveraging mindfulness to combat burnout and boost creativity
​​*Finding focus in busy tech environments
*​​Fostering a corporate culture that connects
*​​AI as a positive change agent in corporate culture

​​Don’t miss this opportunity to connect with forward-thinking peers and gain new tools to shape the future of work in tech. The future is bright!

properties.title: Prompt & Pivot: A Live AI Strategy Simulation
properties.description:
An interactive session for the leaders in the middle, where real transformation happens.

AI conversations are everywhere but most are missing a critical group: middle managers and engineering leads.

Executives are busy setting AI visions. Developers are deep in the technical weeds. But the people in the middle — the ones tasked with translating strategy into action and managing the human response to change, are often left out of the conversation.

This session is for you.

Join us for a hands-on strategy simulation built around a real AI implementation case. Together, we’ll explore:

What to do when your team resists AI tools or feels under-skilled

How to manage up and down; aligning leadership goals with real operational constraints

Why the middle layer holds the power to make or break AI adoption

Expect real talk, shared challenges, and live prompting exercises using ChatGPT to work through decisions in real time.

Whether you're managing engineers, leading product teams, or driving operations, this session will help you clarify your role in AI transformation — and give you practical tools to pivot with confidence.

properties.title: COMMON CODE: Is consent possible in a world of ambient surveillance, advertising and artificial intelligence?
properties.description:

This conversation explores the shifting meaning of informed consent in a world where tech sees, tracks, and predicts us often without our awareness. How do we reclaim agency, and what does ethical design look like when the systems are invisible?

--

Calling all travel tech nerds, jet-lagged founders, overcaffeinated marketers and anyone who's ever said, "I just need 20 minutes and a hotel bed." 

Nappr is pulling up to Toronto Tech Week to host The Future of Travel & Hospitality - one of the few events that's not about AI, crypto, or reinventing the wheel with blockchain...but about actual rest. Revolutionary, we know.

Join us for a night of:

• Sweet, sweet sleep mask + earplug swag
• Free stay giveaways
• Chill vibes, good people, and a few industry secrets we probably shouldn't say out loud

Whether you're in hotels, airlines, OTAs or just here for the drinks, swing on through and let’s talk ZzZs, hospitality, and how to make travel less soul-crushing.

See ya there Toronto! 🛏️🍁🥂

_____
​​About Us

​Nappr is a marketplace that offers 2 to 12-hour hotel stays to help people catch up on rest and meet the demands of their unique schedules. Our network of 1,100+ global properties enables anyone on-the-go to book rooms same-day at chains like Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt, Sheraton and also many boutiques for up to 50% off the overnight rate - and with all of the amenities included. This also gives hotels the ability to fill their unused capacity and generate extra revenue with convenient, hourly scheduling.

Our LinkTree:
https://linktr.ee/nappr
_____

properties.title: AI Community Showcase: Pitch • Demo • Connect
properties.description:
Looking to connect with Toronto’s AI ecosystem in a real, meaningful way? AI Community Showcase is your go-to community night where builders, founders, investors, and curious minds come together to share projects, exchange ideas, and build relationships.

This isn’t a formal conference — it’s an open, high-energy space for pitching, learning, and most importantly, connecting.

🎤 Got something to share?
We offer 5-minute open mic pitch slots for community members!Send your pitch blurb or deck to wendyhuangworkemail@gmail.com

🤝 What to Expect:

Live pitches and demos from local AI startups and builders

A relaxed environment to share early ideas or get feedback

Quality networking — no business cards, just real conversations

A chance to meet future collaborators, co-founders, or investors

Whether you're working on something cool or just want to meet others in the space, come hang out. This is where ideas turn into relationships, and small talks turn into big moves.Let’s grow the AI community — together.

properties.title: Leaders Fund x Mantle | How to Raise VC Financing in Any Market
properties.description: No matter market conditions, great founders still find a way to showcase their business in the right way to raise venture capital. In this candid and unvarnished session, David Stein of Leaders Fund and Amar Varma, serial founder (Xtreme Labs/Hatch/Autonomic) and CEO of Mantle, team up to share the dual perspectives of the investor and operator. Learn what top VCs are looking for in today's environment, how Amar has successfully raised across multiple market cycles, and the common missteps that even the most promising founders make. This session is a must for early-stage founders who want to raise smarter, build trust faster, and increase their odds of success in any funding climate.

properties.title: Scaling Up in Style: Immigration Essentials for Tech Trailblazers
properties.description:
Join us for coffee, conversation and doughnuts at Green and Spiegel, an immigration law firm located in the heart of the financial district!

As tech companies continue to grow and evolve, attracting the right talent and expanding operations across borders has never been more critical. Whether you are a Canadian tech company looking to hire top-tier talent or an entrepreneur aiming to scale your operations into North America, understanding the available immigration pathways is essential.

Both Canada and the United States offer a wide array of immigration programs tailored to meet the needs of the technology sector. From hiring skilled foreign workers to facilitating international expansion, the right immigration options can significantly enhance your company’s growth potential.

properties.title: Frontiers of AI: Vector Institute
properties.description:
​Visit the epicentre of AI innovation — Toronto's Discovery District — where modern artificial intelligence was crafted by Nobel Laureate Geoffrey Hinton and continues to evolve through world-leading research and commercialization. 

​​​Frontiers of AI is a day of programming on June 25 delivered in partnership with MaRS, the University of Toronto (UofT) and Vector Institute, featuring a hands-on showcase of Canadian innovation that is shaping the global future of AI — take part in engaging conversations, demos, workshops and networking. Meet emerging and established leaders in AI, alongside decision-makers in business and tech.

​​​​Located in the heart of Toronto's innovation corridor, this event brings together three powerhouse institutions that have helped establish Toronto as a world-leading AI hub: MaRS, the world's largest urban innovation hubs; the University of Toronto, home to pioneering AI breakthroughs that sparked the global AI revolution and The Vector Institute, renowned for bridging cutting-edge AI research with real-world applications across 32 enterprise partners and 200+ startups.

​Join Vector Institute in the Schwartz Reisman Innovation Campus for discussions about the AI landscape and future of AI Adoption.

properties.title: COMMON CODE: Can we build public spaces that are smart and sovereign?
properties.description:
Public space is changing - with smart tech offering efficiency, artificial intelligence, and real-time data. But what’s the cost of convenience, and who controls the code behind the infrastructure? This dialogue explores how we can embed values like sovereignty, accountability, and collective stewardship into the design of tomorrow’s public spaces.

---

Five days. Five public spaces. Five big questions. 

Common Code is a free pop-up conversation series hosted by Reset that invites Toronto’s tech community to gather in public spaces to explore questions at the intersection of tech, trust, and togetherness in Toronto. Each day, we bring a new question to life in a different neighbourhood that invites Town Hall-like dialogue and debate on topics related to surveillance, sovereignty, safety and more. An unplug valet will be available at each pop-up for anyone wishing to go phone free.

properties.title: Tech Basketball Run - Toronto Tech Week Edition
properties.description:
🏀Welcome to the Toronto Tech Basketball Run! This event is designed for founders, tech enthusiasts, investors, and corporate professionals to come together for a fun, high-energy basketball experience. It's not just about the game—it’s about building meaningful connections with people who share a passion for both technology and sports.

💡Whether you're looking to network, collaborate, or just enjoy some friendly competition, this run offers the perfect space to meet like-minded individuals from across the tech and business community. Beginners are welcome—don’t worry if you’re not a basketball pro! This run is about community and connection as much as it is about the game.

📨There is a capacity to the gym, so spots are limited and available on a first-come, first-served basis, so don’t miss out!

🏷️The drop-in fee helps cover the cost of court rental, ensuring we have a great space to play.

🙌This run invites everyone to step up, connect, and build community both on and off the court. So grab your sneakers, bring your A-game, and get ready to shoot some hoops!

properties.title: The Summer Party Hosted by Golden Ventures & Crosslink Capital
COMMON CODE: Is Toronto’s tech community ready to become leaders in addressing loneliness?
properties.description:
Loneliness is a growing public health crisis - and connection is one of the greatest challenges of our time. Can tech workers and builders in Toronto be part of the solution? This final gathering invites the community to imagine how we design digital tools, spaces, and cultures that reduce isolation and foster belonging.

---

Five days. Five public spaces. Five big questions. 

Common Code is a free pop-up conversation series hosted by Reset that invites Toronto’s tech community to gather in public spaces to explore questions at the intersection of tech, trust, and togetherness in Toronto. Each day, we bring a new question to life in a different neighbourhood that invites Town Hall-like dialogue and debate on topics related to surveillance, sovereignty, safety and more. An unplug valet will be available at each pop-up for anyone wishing to go phone free.

properties.title: AI Tools & Tactics for the Modern Rails Developers
properties.description:
Join us for an exclusive evening happy hour designed for developers and tech professionals. The event will feature complimentary drinks, appetizers, and the opportunity to network with peers in the industry.

​The evening will include a keynote and Q&A session led by Obie Fernandez, who will explore how AI is revolutionizing software development. Drawing from real-world examples in his Olympia app, Obie will outline four ways AI is reshaping the development process—from code helpers to smart subsystems—while sharing practical patterns like “Narrow the Path” and “Multitude of Workers.” This hands-on talk is a guide to not just coding faster, but coding less and coding smarter.

​Attendance is open by application, with acceptances granted on a rolling basis until capacity is reached. Don’t miss this opportunity to learn, connect, and gain actionable insights into the future of AI-driven development.

We are officially part of Toronto Tech Week 2025, a weeklong citywide collection of events to connect and celebrate the builders. June 23 → June 27, 2025 | torontotechweek.com

properties.title: Free Geek Toronto Open House
properties.description:
Are you passionate about sustainability, digital inclusion, or simply love tech? Don’t miss this opportunity to explore Free Geek Toronto’s impactful work in the heart of Toronto!

As a non-profit, tech reuse social enterprise, we’re on a mission to bridge the digital divide and reduce e-waste. We’re opening our doors to show you how we're accomplishing this.

Here’s what you can expect at our open house:

:wrench: Transforming tech
Get an inside look at how we refurbish old devices, giving them new life with secure data wipes, repairs, and open-source software. We’re not just fixing computers—we’re creating affordable tech solutions for individuals and organizations in need.

:earth_africa: Sustainable solutions
 Discover how our eco-friendly tech programs are making a difference, from reducing e-waste to offering green solutions that support both local communities and the planet.

:bulb: Supporting digital inclusion
By partnering with local organizations, we provide low-cost technology and job training to communities facing barriers to tech access. Learn how you can help expand opportunities for those in need, while developing skills for yourself.

:seedling: Network with like-minded innovators
Whether you're a techie, an environmental advocate, or just someone looking to give back, you'll meet others who are eager to make a positive impact through technology.

We’re more than just a tech hub; we’re a community-driven force for good. Come see how we’re building a more inclusive, sustainable future—one 
computer at a time.

Join us at Free Geek Toronto’s Open House! Let’s build a greener, more inclusive digital world—together. :computer::recycle: See you there!

properties.title: Lunch & Learn: A Roundtable for First-Time Investors
properties.description:
Thinking about making your first tech investment? Join GSA Ventures for a relaxed and insightful lunch roundtable on May 8 at 11:00 AM, hosted at Global Startups HQ.

We’re gathering a small group of aspiring investors to explore what it really takes to spot early-stage companies with big potential — often overlooked by mainstream capital. Our lens? Traction, grit, and real-world performance over hype.

In this two-hour session, we’ll cover:

* How venture capital works at the earliest stages
* What syndicated funds are — and how they fit into the investment landscape
* Lessons from nearly a decade supporting startups and writing our first cheque

If you’re looking to learn, connect, and explore the tech investment world without the jargon, this lunch is for you.

properties.title: Beyond the Resume: Secrets of a Recruiter... Spot Hidden High-Potential Talent and Top HR Hiring Mistakes
properties.description:
You and a guest are invited to Beyond the Resume: Secrets of a Recruiter... Spot Hidden High-Potential Talent and Top HR Hiring Mistakes.

This is a private, complimentary breakfast and roundtable series for founders, HR leaders, and hiring managers, where we will discuss relevant topics and share valuable insights on the secrets to successfully attracting, hiring, and retaining high-potential candidates in record time.

For over a decade, Linkus Group has been on a mission to reshape recruitment and hiring practices. We've helped hire thousands of top talent for 500+ founder-led startups and small businesses as they grow from 1 to 100 employees—hiring only the best and most aligned candidates for the job.

We take immense pride in connecting with our community, educating businesses, and masterfully crafting industry-leading teams.

Join us for Beyond the Resume: Secrets of a Recruiter for insightful, leader-led conversations.

properties.title: City of Toronto Networking Reception - June 2025
properties.description:
Discover the power of connection by joining the City of Toronto on Thursday, June 26, 2025, for a Networking Reception during the first edition of Toronto Tech Week. This exclusive event brings together a mix of the City's leading innovation champions, innovative founders, visionary investors, influential policymakers, and senior government officials—all in one place.

Whether you are looking to spark new partnerships, explore investment opportunities, or dive into the heart of Toronto’s thriving tech ecosystem, this is your chance to connect with the people shaping the future. Come and discover why Toronto is North America’s fastest-growing technology hub and experience the energy driving its innovation economy.

Admission is free, but space is limited. Ensure you register by June 13, 2025 to secure your spot.

Hor d'oeuvres and refreshments will be served.

We are officially part of Toronto Tech Week 2025, a weeklong citywide collection of events to connect and celebrate the builders. June 23 → June 27, 2025 | torontotechweek.com

properties.title: Rejection Olympics | Cansbridge 10X Kick Off & TO Tech Week Youth Meetup
properties.description:
​For 14 years, The Cansbridge Fellowship has been empowering Canada's next-generation leaders and founders to boldly chase their dreams.

​By stretching their comfort zones and becoming comfortable with the possibility of rejection or failure, they become confident and resilient. As Cansbridge's founder always says, "don't ask, don't get" and "what's the worse that can happen".

​This Toronto Tech Week, Cansbridge is taking their classic activity, "Rejection Olympics", to the next level by inviting 100 young leaders and builders to face rejection with us.

​Fellows who have done this activity say they've become "a changed person", and "can do anything now" - so register today to level up with the Cansbridge community.

​This is the kick-off event to "Cansbridge 10X", a FREE summer event series for youth (ages 18–29) in Canada to boost their mindset, skill set, and network in order to accelerate their career or entrepreneurial path. To join the rest of the series, which is generously supported by RBC, register here: https://www.bouncelife.com/events/6826500ac14246684dd014d4

​About Cansbridge: Since 2011, the Cansbridge Fellowship has empowered 250 young leaders and entrepreneurs with an opportunity to work in Asia's innovation ecosystem. Alumni raised over $150M for their startups, generated over $400M ARR, been recognized by Forbes 30U30 and Rhodes, and have given back over $0.5M to enable future Fellow positions.

​About RBC: RBC is dedicated to driving positive impact through community investments aligned to ambitions defined in their Purpose Framework. One ambition is to “Equip people with the skills for a thriving future”, which aims to provide people with skill building, mentorships, work experience, and more, in an age of increasing disruption.

properties.title: Muslims in Tech: Founder Collective
properties.description:

2) ​Build Community Connections: Foster meaningful conversations among founders, founding engineers and early operators.
​3) Amplify Visibility: Share the stories of Muslims transforming the landscape of tech.

What’s the vibe?

Think startup energy meets community warmth. We’re bringing together founders at every stage – from “I have this crazy idea” to “we just closed our Series A” – for real talk about building companies, navigating the tech ecosystem, and supporting each other along the way.
